title: Been Saying It, Still Saying It: Support Itemization SUCKS
body:
Not in terms of "strength", but in terms of fun and what makes League what it is, yes, support-oriented itemization is *garbage*. **Hot garbage.**

If I'm playing any position other than support, my itemization choices look like this:

- Who am I? What do I scale with best?

- What is the situation? Should I take a more careful, defensive approach to my build or should I race to end-game status, getting as offensively potent as possible earlier on?

If I'm SUPPORT, my itemization decisions look like this:

- Build the biggest effect that gives the biggest benefit for your team.

This is *inherently flawed logic.* Where someone playing Ahri could say "That's a Veigar, so instead of risking getting clicked on in his ranges, I'ma put the Lich Bane build down and get an Abyssal Sceptor instead." or "That's a Zed, so I'ma put the Abyssal to the side and build a Zhonya's", a support says "I'm going to build Locket/Redemption because that's thousands upon thousands of hp sustain for my team." Doesn't matter if you're Blitz. Doesn't matter if you're Braum. Doesn't matter if you're Sona. Doesn't matter if you're Janna. EVERY SUPPORT BUILDS THESE ITEMS, and the worst part is that there's no reason not to. Nothing matches their potency when it counts, and Locket has a 90 second cd, meaning it's up for basically *every* team fight. There's no consideration of "My champion is X" because support itemization as a whole disregards this concept. Or rather, *the items worth building do.*

Like, I don't see why people are scratching their heads on support. Support needs people to actually care enough to fix the problems it has, is all, before we can make it a more fun role. The problems are not even that hard to find. These items are **inherently** broken in the role. We need these items replaced with itemization choices that better fit specific champ classes that find themselves in the role, as well as choices that adhere to specific types of situations, not catch-all answers that are always good, which is what Redemption and Locket are.

Side note: A shameless plug to my last thread on the role

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/TVVuiRr0-the-problem-with-enchanters

Those two items water down the entire support role and make the individual champions more generic.

It doesn't matter if you pick an enchanter, a tank, a peeler, or a mage - they all have access to the same support powers.

You don't need to pick Karma for AoE shields because everyone can buy Locket.  You don't need to pick Sona for multi-person healing because everyone can buy Locket for a large AoE heal.

You don't even need to pick a champion with healing or shielding to get those for your team.

Itemisation for other classes augments the powers that the champions already have in their kits.  AP items help mages make their spells more powerful, for example.
The two items mentioned simply add a completely different power to a champion, regardless of their kit.
